faq.question: What is Coffee Engine?
faq.answer:
CoffeeEngine is a small but powerful layer that sits between your users and your AI features.

Think of it as a payment-aware gate:

â€¢ A user wants to access a Custom GPT or AI-powered feature
â€¢ CoffeeEngine checks whether they've supported you (for example, by buying you a coffee)
â€¢ If yes â†’ access granted
â€¢ If not â†’ a friendly nudge instead of a hard paywall

It's designed for developers who want to monetize without:
â€¢ building full subscription systems
â€¢ managing user accounts
â€¢ or turning their project into a SaaS monster

Lightweight, modular, and embeddable anywhere.

faq.label: ğŸš€ How does it work?
faq.question: How does Coffee Engine work?
faq.answer:
At its core, CoffeeEngine does one thing very well:

It verifies payments and turns them into access signals.

â€¢ A payment provider sends a signal (API / webhook / verification call)
â€¢ CoffeeEngine validates it
â€¢ Your app or Custom GPT asks: "Is this user allowed?"
â€¢ CoffeeEngine answers with a clear yes / no

No user database required.
No long-lived sessions required.
Just simple, verifiable logic you can trust.

faq.question: How do I set this up?
faq.answer:
Getting started is intentionally boring (in a good way):

1. Clone the repository
   Everything you need is already there.

2. Create a Buy Me a Coffee API key
   This is how CoffeeEngine verifies payments.

3. Deploy to Vercel
   One-click deploy, edge-friendly, zero infra stress.

4. Set your environment variables
   API keys, secrets, done.

Once deployed, you can plug CoffeeEngine into:
â€¢ Custom GPT actions
â€¢ AI-powered web apps
â€¢ Internal tools
â€¢ Experiments

If it can make an HTTP request, it can use CoffeeEngine.
